intro: Echinops lalesarensis, commonly known as the Lalesarensis thistle, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, spiny foliage. The plant features a tall, erect stem with dense, spiny leaves that help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Its purple-blue flower heads appear in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Echinops lalesarensis is adapted to thrive in poor soils and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
